results.title: Farewell my concubine
results.creator_credit: Chen Kaige, Hsu Feng, Tomson Films, Maverick and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Chen Kiage’s spellbinding tale of betrayal is as sprawling and colourful as China itself. This awe-inspiring drama centres on the incredible lives of two stars from the Peking opera who find themselves hopelessly entwined in the turbulence of 20th Century China. Twice banned from Chinese cinemas because of the controversial content, this visually stunning film leaves no stone unturned to create a rich and emotionally powerful screen epic. Nominated for the Best Foreign Film Academy Award. Mandarin dialogue with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chen Kaige, Hsu Feng, Tomson Films, Maverick and Miramax Films

results.title: Farewell Moscow
results.creator_credit: Mauro Bolognini, Enrico Roseo and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Ida Nudel, played by Liv Ullmann in one of the finest performances of her career, is a Russian scientist, a violinist and a Jew. She dearly loves her sister Elena, and Juli, a young poet interned as a dissident. She loves the synagogue, she even loves her ex-husband. But most of all she loves Russia, and does not want to leave. As the Jewish persecutions grow more violent she finally decides the time has come to leave Russia, for her personal safety. Through all her trials and tribulations her old spirit remains unbroken and she becomes an inspiration to a whole generation of Russian Jews.

results.title: Fantasia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated feast of music and visuals. Featuring a soundtrack of classical music, including selections by Bach, Tchaikovsky and Moussorgsky, the film weds animated narratives to the famous musical pieces. “Fantasia” includes one of Disney’s most loved sequences, “The Sorcerer’s Apprentice”. At its best the film’s animation remains magical and visually breath-taking.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.title: Fanny By Gaslight
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith, Edward Black, Gainsborough Pictures and GFD
results.brief_description: The illegitimate daughter of a British cabinet minister, in the latter half of the 19th century, begins a new life as a lady’s maid in her real father’s household. She learns the facts of her parentage and a strong affection develops between her and her father. When his wife learns the truth and threatens a public scandal, he commits suicide. Starring James Mason and Phyllis Calvert. Based on the novel by Michael Sadleir.

results.title: Fanny
results.brief_description:
Fanny has allowed Marius to leave her to become a sailor without telling him she was expecting his child. In order to avoid dishonor, Fanny’s mother, Honorine, is pushing the young woman to marry the wealthy and much older Panisse. Upon his return Marius learns about the wedding and the reason for so much haste. Careful to secure a future for ‘his’ grand son, Cesar, Marius’ father, persuades him to renounce any claim to the child. ‘Fanny’ is the second installement of Pagnol’s Marseille trilogy, started with ‘Marius’.

Credits: Producer, Roger Richebe ; director, Marc Allegret ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Nicola Toporkoff ; music, Vincent Scotto, Georges Sellers ; producer’s assistants, Pierre Prevert, Yves Allegret.
Cast: Raimu, Orane Demazis, Pierre Fresnay, Fernand Charpin, Alida Rouffe.

results.title: Poussiere D'ange = Angel Dust
results.brief_description:
Inspector Simon Blount, 34, has lost his taste for water since his wife left him for restaurant proprietor Igor. When asked by Commissaire Florimont to investigate a series of supermarket burglaries, Simon befriends angel-faced Violetta who ‘lives’ in the bedding department of a supermarket. Violetta happens to have a keen interest in Commissaire Florimont whom she suspect was involved in the murder of her mother many years ago. Film noir archetypes are evident throughout ‘Poussiere d’ange’, in the mise-en-scene, narrative voice over and characterisation as much as in the generic plot (rogue detective with morals uncovers coruption in high places). The consistently underlit or nocturnal mise-en-scene, the ubiquitous rain, and the seedy urban locations are all reminiscent of classic Hollywood film noir. But it is above all in the knowing characterisation of the detective hero that the genre is most evident. In both actions and appearance, Simon is a hyperbolic version of the crumpled private eye. He narrates his own story with the laconic humour typical of the genre. The traditional ambiguity of the film noir hero - is he a criminal or a lawman? - is epitomised in the scene where he wakes up in the drunk-tank in his own police station. His exaggeratedly dishevelled appearance - unshaven, clutching a bottle of whisky, wearing an overcoat and practically living in his beat-up car - identifies him with ‘the earlier iconography of, say, Sam Spade or Philip Marlowe.” Reference: Guy Austin. ‘Contemporary French Cinema: an introduction’. Manchester University Press, 1996.

Credits: Director, Edouard Niermans ; writers, Jacques Audiard, Didier Haudepin, Alain Le Henry, Edouard Niermans ; photography, Bernard Lutic ; music, Vincent-Marie Bouvot, Jacques Witta.
Cast: Bernard Giraudeau, Fanny Bastien, Fanny Cottencon, Jean-Pierre Sentier, Michel Aumont.

results.title: The National fitness story
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Shell and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
The Federal Minister for Health briefly introduces the “Fit to Live” series, after which the overall objectives and activities of the National Fitness movement throughout Australia are depicted. Story by Noel McDonald with Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Pour la Peau D'un Flic = for a Cop's Hide
results.brief_description:
Choucas, a former cop turned private investigator, is asked by an old lady to investigate the disappearance of a young blind girl. It all seem a very mundane case. But shortly after starting the investigation, Choucas receives the visit of a very strange and nosy person. Then, later on, the old lady is murdered on her way to a meeting with Choucas.

Credits: Producer, director, Alain Delon ; writers, Alain Delon, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Oscar Benton ; art direction, Theo Meurisse.
Cast: Alain Delon, Anne Parillaud, Daniel Ceccaldi, Michel Auclair.

results.title: Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Part of an instructional film series from 1969-70 about the training of Australia’s youth. Thirteen colour films of ten minutes duration were made under the auspices of the Cultural Council for National Fitness. The films focus on National Fitness Camps, sports, family recreation and exercises for people of all ages. Sponsored by the Shell Company, the films were made to emphasis the need for physical fitness amongst all age groups. This film deals with the prevention and rehabilitation of heart disease through exercise.

results.title: Family recreation
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Artransa Park Studios and Shell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Australians in most walks of life now have more leisure time at their disposal. There are many enjoyable, interesting and healthy ways of utilising this leisure time, and this film gives many suggestions - and much food for thought.
